main event: Several witnesses observed a large egg-shaped object near Levelland, Texas, causing their vehicle engines to stall, on November 2, 1957.
interesting points: The object was reported to be about 200 feet in length and emitted a bright bluish-white light., Multiple witnesses including motorists and sheriff deputies all reported similar experiences of their vehicles losing power when the object approached., The Air Force concluded that the incident was potentially caused by ball lightning or other natural phenomena., The sightings caused a media sensation, leading to extensive investigations by the Air Force., The incident was heavily publicized and sparked interest in similar sightings across the nation.
witness description: Motorists and local residents, including law enforcement.
